widget.title: Best Effort - CPU and memory not set

timeSeriesQuery.timeSeriesQueryLanguage:
{ usage:
    fetch k8s_container
    | metric 'kubernetes.io/container/cpu/core_usage_time'
    | filter
        (resource.namespace_name != 'kube-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'istio-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'gatekeeper-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'gke-system')
    | align rate(1m)
    | within 3d
    | group_by
        [resource.cluster_name, resource.location, resource.project_id,
         metadata.system.top_level_controller_name],
        [value_core_usage_time_aggregate: percentile(value.core_usage_time, 70)]
; requested:
    fetch k8s_container
    | metric 'kubernetes.io/container/cpu/request_cores'
    | filter
        (resource.namespace_name != 'kube-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'istio-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'gatekeeper-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'gke-system')
    | group_by
        [resource.cluster_name, resource.location, resource.project_id,
         metadata.system.top_level_controller_name],
        [value_request_cores_mean: mean(value.request_cores)]
    | filter value_request_cores_mean != 0 }
| every 1m
| join
| filter
    sub(requested.value_request_cores_mean,
      usage.value_core_usage_time_aggregate) < 0
| group_by
    [resource.cluster_name, resource.location, resource.project_id,
     metadata.system.top_level_controller_name],
    [row_count: row_count()]

widget.title: CPU (performance risk) - containers running above requested for CPU

timeSeriesQuery.timeSeriesQueryLanguage:
{ burstable_workloads_at_risk:
 { usage:
    fetch k8s_container
    | metric 'kubernetes.io/container/cpu/core_usage_time'
    | filter
        (resource.namespace_name != 'kube-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'istio-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'gatekeeper-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'gke-system')
    | align rate(1m)
    | within 3d
    | group_by [pod_name],
        [value_core_usage_time_aggregate: percentile(value.core_usage_time, 70)]
; burstable:
    fetch k8s_container
    | metric 'kubernetes.io/container/cpu/request_cores'
    | filter
        (resource.namespace_name != 'kube-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'istio-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'gatekeeper-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'gke-system')
    | group_by [pod_name], [value_request_cores_mean: mean(value.request_cores)]
    | filter value_request_cores_mean != 0 }
| every 1m
| window 3d
| join
| filter
    sub(burstable.value_request_cores_mean,
      usage.value_core_usage_time_aggregate) < 0
| group_by [pod_name], [row_count: row_count()]
| group_by [], [row_count_sum: sum(row_count)]
| value row_count_sum
;all_containers: fetch k8s_container
    | metric 'kubernetes.io/container/cpu/request_cores'
    | filter
        (resource.namespace_name != 'kube-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'istio-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'gatekeeper-system'
         && resource.namespace_name != 'gke-system')
      | group_by [pod_name], [row_count: row_count()]
      | group_by [], [row_count_sum: sum(row_count)]
    }   
    |join
    | value scale(div(burstable_workloads_at_risk.row_count_sum,all_containers.row_count_sum), '%')

widget.title: % of pods memory running above requested

timeSeriesQuery.timeSeriesQueryLanguage:
fetch k8s_container
| metric 'kubernetes.io/container/memory/request_bytes'
| filter
    (resource.namespace_name != 'kube-system'
     && resource.namespace_name != 'istio-system'
     && resource.namespace_name != 'gatekeeper-system'
     && resource.namespace_name != 'gke-system')
| { all_containers: align mean_aligner()
  ; best_effort_containers:
      group_by 1m, [value_request_bytes_mean: mean(value.request_bytes)]
      | filter value_request_bytes_mean == 0 }
| every 1m
| group_by [resource.pod_name], [row_count: row_count()]
| group_by [], [row_count_sum: sum(row_count)]
| join
| window 5m
| value
    [v_0:
       scale(
         div(best_effort_containers.row_count_sum,
           all_containers.row_count_sum),
         '%')]

text.content:
[Set appropriate resource requests and limits](https://cloud.google.com/architecture/best-practices-for-running-cost-effective-kubernetes-applications-on-gke#set_appropriate_resource_requests_and_limits) - When **memory** isn't set and guaranteed, *kubelet* can **kill your Pods, at any time, and mark them as failed** . 
- When **CPU** isn't set, containers can be **throttled to 0 causing your workloads to become unresponsive** .
